p: CoVs show high robustness and survival under suitable temperature and relative humidity (30–50%) conditions and a slow decay rate that mainly involves nucleic acid changes. 23 MERS-CoV is still infectious after 60 minutes of aerosolization at 25°C and 79% RH. 24 Under room temperature conditions, SARS-CoV can survive in feces/sputum for 1–5 d, 10–19 days in urine, 15 d in blood, and 3 d on surfaces; SARS-CoV can survive for around 21 d at 4°C and for a long period of time at −70°C. 25 These viruses are extremely heat-sensitive and can be effectively inactivated by 56°C for 30 min or 70°C for 15 min. 26
